sub_title: I design immersive computer & VR training simulations so that your organization can have fun interactive serious games as your smart automated virtual teachers (B2B SaaS, EdTech, game design, learning experience design)!
summary:
About me:

☛ lived in 4 countries
☛ worked in 3 countries
☛ finished 2 Masters: (MSc Information and Communication Sciences, MA Education of Philosophy)
☛ have 1 goal: to combine art, tech & education for a positive impact


I make educational virtual simulations, tailored for each B2B need. They are cross-platform and work on:
💻 computer
📱 mobile
🥽 VR
😎 AR

Our training solutions are customized for various industries:
🏫 EDUCATION - eg. teach students about jets
🚀 AERO/SPACE - eg. astronauts to fly spacecrafts
🚆 AUTOMOTIVE - eg. car mechanics to fix cars
🏭 INDUSTRY - eg. factory workers to do lototo
🏥 HEALTHCARE - eg. surgeons to use equipment
🛠️ MAINTENANCE - eg. mechanics to fix machines
⛑️ SAFETY - eg. construction workers to learn VCA

BlueTea serious games can also teach soft skills. 🗣️🤝


What is our flow?

1️⃣ I analyse the customer's process and learning goal.
2️⃣ I make the game design document (create the project concept).
3️⃣ Based on my product specifications, our Unity engineers develop the 3D environment.
4️⃣ I use VirtualStudio® (our game design SaaS) to design educational content - all game interactions (flow, narrative, game mechanics, scoring, sound, QA).
5️⃣ I also onboard, teach, guide and support our customers to use our SaaS, so they can design their own training simulations.


I design flexible serious games with a smart virtual mentor who adapts to the players, tracks their progress and guides them to learn - also through making mistakes! 📈📊



Customers I've worked with:

🔗 Bayer
🔗 DSM (Dutch State Mines)
🔗 MUMC (Maastricht University Medical Center)
🔗 NLR (National Laboratory for Aerospace)
🔗 VISTA college etc.



I am experienced with:

✅ game design
✅ serious game development
✅ instructional design
✅ B2B SaaS
✅ EdTech
✅ team leadership
✅ product ownership
✅ research



Some of my accomplishments:

✔ coauthored an e-learning paper, published at the international conference under the high auspices of President of the Republic of Croatia

✔ managed the e-learning project for implementation of 3D tech in school projects, in collaboration with the university and the commercial sector

✔ up-skilled 40+ international specialists at Uber, with tech & soft skills required to successfully manage highly sensitive incidents

✔ designed 6 serious computer/VR games and 50+ levels, including large-scale global projects



Every experience is a growth & learning opportunity. I appreciate empathy, persistence, intrinsic motivation, intellectual curiosity, scientific reasoning and application of interdisciplinary knowledge!

projects.title: Survey research at University of Zagreb - teacher's attitude on e-learning
projects.description:
The purpose of this article was to investigate teachers’ attitude about e-learning; it attempts to investigate the current teachers’ opinions and awareness about e-learning, their activities pertaining to e-learning, as well as their motivation and initiative, or lack of them. The target group were the teaching staff of the faculties of the University of Zagreb who were sent a link to the online survey. By looking at the results of SRCE’s annual survey, which was sent to UNIZG’s faculty administration, it was assumed that teachers show motivation and interest in using e-learning, however, they lack support of their respective faculties, as well as technological prerequisites to implement e-learning in their teaching. Another assumption was that some faculties would have bigger and some a smaller need for e-learning, depending on their field of study. To test these hypotheses, a survey was sent to each UNIZG faculty with instructions to pass it along to members of their teaching staff. There were 315 participants in the survey, and data analysis confirmed great majority of the authors’ hypotheses; it was concluded that the majority of participant teaching staff at UNIZG, irrespective of their age, is motivated and interested in the idea of e-learning, but lack the incentive and support to engage with it.
http://infoz.ffzg.hr/INFuture/ConferenceProgram.aspx

profile_positions.company: BlueTea, Experts in Game Based Training
profile_positions.description:
ROLE:
Instructional designer 
Game designer
Project architect
Project lead
B2B SaaS consultant

TASKS:
● create development roadmap plans (game design docs) for each B2B project
● create product development specifications for project features with the Unity team
● implement the best techniques from didactics, psychology and pedagogy to the learning content 
● design serious games for VR, computer and mobile
● design the game scenario (concept, non-linear branching scenario flow, narrative, interaction, game mechanics, sound, scoring, randomization)
● QA: test, report bugs, do fixes, suggest solutions
● manage the projects internally and externally
● create technical specifications for new innovative tools & game features, monitor their development
● onboard, teach, guide and support customers to use our in-house developed game design software
● mentor and coach intern/postdoc colleague with their graduate or AI projects

RESULTS:
✔ designed 6 games, including large-scale global projects
✔ (re)designed 50+ levels - try the Covid-19 level for free: https://www.safy.online
✔ developed certification game mechanics design - added a competitive value to our products
✔ designed and developed the knowledge base on Confluence targeted for our customers
✔ redesigned the UI and UX blueprint for company's LMS software: https://www.virtual-studio.nl
✔ educated 40+ people to use our SaaS

WHAT I LEARNED:
I have the lead in instructional design, being responsible for developing the project architecture and educational gamified training scenarios. I collaborated directly with National Laboratory for Aerospace (NLR), Dutch Ministry of Defense (https://www.bluetea.eu/post/joined-forces-with-nlr), Bayer, Maastricht University Medical Clinic, DSM and other B2B customers. That brought insights about customer processes and needs from a broad specter of large-scale organizations from the automotive, pharmaceutical, aerospace, military, mechanical industries, schools and universities.
profile_positions.title: Instructional Game Designer

profile_positions.description:
ROLE:
Incident Response Team trainer for the international ComOps team
Quality Assurance POC

TASKS:
● investigating, communication, documenting and resolving special sensitive cases in EMEA (Incident Response Team)
● training EMEA specialists to become IRT experts through workshops, e-learning and knowledge assessments
● teaching EMEA specialists to use various complex tools and procedures to manage global safety cases
● equipping EMEA specialists with soft skills, technical skills and stakeholder management skills
● performing internal policy audits for the global safety projects and teaching specialists to do it 
● testing different teaching strategies and tracking the results
● analyzing the corporate global safety IRT training curriculum and developing EMEA market-specific adaptations 
● delivering the global well-being program with local adaptations, with the aim to increase employees' emotional intelligence, provide well-being care tools and to increase their empathy
● reporting and tracking bugs and global outages with the Development and Insight teams

RESULTS:
✔ equipped 40+ EMEA international specialists to become qualified Incident Response Team experts
✔ submitted 90+ global policy improvement reports that increased the communications logic quality
✔ analyzed payment and geofencing issues and suggested 10+ application improvement solutions

WHAT I LEARNED:
I learned how Community Operations work with the central Development team while using Global Standardization, Machine Learning and Automation products to improve safety, account security and support processes. I worked across multiple international departments and gained new stakeholder management skills. I learned which CommOps metrics factors, in a large-scale global shared-economy business, cut costs while increasing operations productivity and quality.
profile_positions.title: Incident Response Team trainer

WHAT I LEARNED:
I worked at international business management projects and learned how to use tools and strategies from the field of economics, marketing, business strategy, international distribution and sales, new home control&automation technology, international IoT Z-wave market and EU funds project documentation.
profile_positions.title: International Business Developer

profile_positions.description:
ROLE:
1 year President and 2 years Marketing manager for the Faculty's of Humanities and Social Sciences Rowing club in Zagreb.

TASKS:
●  working with the club's vice president, treasurer, trainer, students and others
●  rowing club contract conclusions and competition applications
●  managing and executing club's plan for current and future activities and finances
●  developing and executing marketing activities (paper advertising, promotions, events)
●  establishing partnerships (eg. with artists, media, organisations and sponsors)
●  developing and executing sponsorship and donation acquiring activities
●  managing and executing digital marketing on Facebook page (content creation and management, events, ads, promotions, advertising campaigns, page analytics...)
●  documentation archival using web-based collaborative management software
●  digital communications

RESULTS:
✔ archived and organised all of the club's documentation and tasks on cloud
✔ established collaboration with 10+ sponsors and partners
✔ featured on the national television through a TVS reportage https://vimeo.com/170126734
✔ received more than 15.000 kn of sponsorship/donation money or services/goods
✔ sent both crews on a 4 day free trip to participate in an international regatta in Warsaw, Poland

WHAT I LEARNED:
This job was a fantastic learning opportunity because in the first year (working as the president and as the marketing manager) I could experiment and try out whatever I wanted. In the second year (working as the marketing manager) I could join forces with others. Both produced great results and required a lot of independence and responsibility. I learned new things about management, creative marketing, event planning and team spirit.

I joined Upwork and did a contracted a few freelance jobs for the purpose of learning how this highly competitive global freelance market works. I learned about the portfolio worth, referencing and the extreme segmentation of freelancers into two distinct groups on this platform.

By joining the web portal's student team, I acquired a lot of new skills related to organisation infrastructure, project managing software, web analytics, SEO, online content publishing, digital marketing etc. By doing my job here, I had to learn-by-doing from scratch about video editing software, and also strengthened my strategic planning and management skills.

company.name: Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences

profile_positions.company: Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences
profile_positions.description:
ROLE:
Project manager of faculty students' service learning project - designing and conducting a hybrid e-learning course for high-school students on the topic of 3D digitization. 
https://sites.google.com/site/o3dprojekt/home

TASKS:
●  initiating the project (gathering the team, defining the goals, directing activities towards them, managing the project documentation)
●  planning (creating weekly/monthly work schedule, task breakdown, assigning the tasks, creating milestone deadlines, creating backup plans, developing marketing strategy)
●  executing (contacting project partners, collaboration establishment, executing project tasks, coordinating and motivating the project team)
●  controlling (monitoring the project development, handling pop-up risks)
●  closing (finalizing activities, follow-up, analysis, reports)

RESULTS:
✔ designed and created an entire Moodle course
✔ arranged 3D scanning and 3D printing workshops with partners
✔ educated 30+ people (professors and students) about e-learning
✔ actively involved 50+ people to participate (teachers and students) and educated them on how to apply 3D in their profession
✔ issued 3D certificates for students who finished the course

WHAT I LEARNED:
This showed that a project and team lead must set a positive example and always have backup plans ready. I loved the logistics, but since the human factor (with many participants) was the most challenging task to manage, win-win games had to be played both for team members and for project partners. In successful negotiations, one must pay attention to tending to other people's interests.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

Doing simple assistance tasks along with other students was easy, but got me a chance to participate in formal proceedings. By being liable for the conference photography, besides application of appropriate photography techniques for specific work environment, I also had to do organization and management.
